channel.title: Comments on: Brief survey of the history of hermeneutics â€“ 6. Alexandria and Antioch

item.title: By: Richard Barcellos
item.dc:creator: Richard Barcellos
item.description: Ramm is an old standard. I have not read Goldsworthy's Gospel Hermeneutics but hear great things about it.
item.content:encoded: Ramm is an old standard. I have not read Goldsworthy’s Gospel Hermeneutics but hear great things about it.

item.title: By: Andrew Suttles
item.dc:creator: Andrew Suttles
item.description:
Thanks again. I'll check those out, also. I've looked at the TOC at Amazon for the Plummer book and it has peaked my interest.
In addition to Berkhof, I already have Bernard Ramm, though I've not yet read him.
item.content:encoded:
Thanks again. I’ll check those out, also. I’ve looked at the TOC at Amazon for the Plummer book and it has peaked my interest.

In addition to Berkhof, I already have Bernard Ramm, though I’ve not yet read him.

item.title: By: Rich B.
item.dc:creator: Rich B.
item.description: ...though not comprehensive like Plummer and Berkhof.
item.content:encoded: …though not comprehensive like Plummer and Berkhof.

item.title: By: Rich B.
item.dc:creator: Rich B.
item.description: Also, David Dockery, Biblical Interpretation Then and Now is very good.
item.content:encoded: Also, David Dockery, Biblical Interpretation Then and Now is very good.

item.title: By: Andrew Suttles
item.dc:creator: Andrew Suttles
item.description:
Thanks for the help. I'll see if I can inter-library loan your recommended text.
Andrew
item.content:encoded:
Thanks for the help. I’ll see if I can inter-library loan your recommended text.

Andrew

item.title: By: Richard Barcellos
item.dc:creator: Richard Barcellos
item.description:
These come from my hermeneutics lectures at MCTS. I might do something with some of this material in the years to come.
I like Berkhof, though I disagree with his assessment of post-Reformation Reformed Orthodoxy (i.e. Scholasticism). There is much good stuff there, though. I like Plummer's new one - 40 Questions About Intepreting the Bible.
item.content:encoded:
These come from my hermeneutics lectures at MCTS. I might do something with some of this material in the years to come.

I like Berkhof, though I disagree with his assessment of post-Reformation Reformed Orthodoxy (i.e. Scholasticism). There is much good stuff there, though. I like Plummer’s new one – 40 Questions About Intepreting the Bible.

item.title: By: Andrew Suttles
item.dc:creator: Andrew Suttles
item.description:
Dr. B -
I wonder if you might have any end goals with respect to this hermeneutics series? Would you consider putting your thoughts into a hermeneutics manual of some sort once the series is concluded?
Also, is there a basic overview text that you would recommend? I believer Dr. Malone prefers Berkhof.
Thanks,
Andrew
item.content:encoded:
Dr. B –

I wonder if you might have any end goals with respect to this hermeneutics series? Would you consider putting your thoughts into a hermeneutics manual of some sort once the series is concluded?

Also, is there a basic overview text that you would recommend? I believer Dr. Malone prefers Berkhof.

Thanks,

Andrew
